page.title: 05Brecon tourist attractions.
page.content: The main attractions of Brecon are its old buildings. The oldest building in Brecon today is the castle which was built in 1093. It is now in ruins and is not open to the public. Another old building is the Museum. It was originaly build as a Shire Hall but was converted into a Court House and then to the Museum. St Mary's Church is a beautiful old building with a high bell tower. The tower is prominent land mark and known as{Buckingham tower}after the{Duke of {Buckingham}who was born in Brecon. When the Normans built the castle they also founded a priory which has been developed into a {Cathedral.}The Cathedral is a building of much interest . Among its main attractions are a very rare crescent stone and the chapel of the{Cardwainers Guild.
